item.title: Ticket #241 (MetaWeblog editPost incorrectly changes post_date) created
item.dc:creator: face
item.description: When a MetaWeblog API request to editPost is received the post_date is set to the current date when the 'dateCreated' element of the message is not found. This element is optional and should not be changed for an edit. The more appropriate date manipulation should be performed on the post_modified dates

20:

The good news is I found the typo which is probably causing this.

The bad news is I can't get pingbacks to work on my dev blog.

item.dc:creator: saxmatt

item.title: Ticket #236 (Auto-linked URLs ending with ',' shouldn't include the '.') updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: The patch ate trailing characters after autolinks and didn't account for commas, another common problem we run into. I checked in a new version of this function that includes a general cleanup and fixes the reported bug.

item.title: Ticket #239 (post_category column was never assigned values) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Nothing should be using that column anymore, now all category information should be in the post2cat table.

item.title: Changeset [1570]: 404 permalink handler.
item.dc:creator: rboren

item.title: Ticket #240 (duplicate category names cause DB error even on different category levels) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
WP does not allow duplicate category names at all which (I believe :-) is incorrect behaviour.

Duplicate category names should be allowed if they are on different levels. For instance, the category setup below is not possible.

[CATEGORIES] Travel

-Articles -Sites

CSS

-Tutorials -Articles

The two 'Articles' sub cats will conflict as a duplicate name.

So:

  • Duplicates should be allowed on different category levels
  • Duplicates should not be allowed on the same category level
